required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Empowering Patients to Better Manage Diabetes Through Self-Care
clinical_study.official_title: Empowering Patients to Better Manage Diabetes Through Self-Care

brief_summary.textblock: This study will look at the impact of health insurance benefits on self management of diabetes for people with this condition. Studies have shown that when people with diabetes manage their disease better, they stay healthier. Our goal in this study is to help those with diabetes better manage their disease (self-care). We will compare two types of health insurance benefits in this study. We want to see if one set of benefits improves self-care more than the other one.

detailed_description.textblock:
The objective of this particular study is to determine if the addition of regular pharmacist visits to usual care can improve clinical outcomes in patients with diabetes. The central hypothesis is that a program overseen by community pharmacists that empowers patients to self-manage their diabetes will lead to improved clinical and humanistic outcomes and will be cost-effective. Strong preliminary data collected from other sites suggests that patient empowerment programs are effective at reducing hemoglobin A1C after 12 months and in reducing the total cost of care. This hypothesis will be tested by pursuing three specific aims to evaluate the impact of a pharmacist-administered diabetes patient empowerment program on:
1. clinical markers for diabetes and related metabolic disorders;
2. the cost of care and resource utilization; and
3. patient knowledge and perceived ability to manage diabetes. There is an additional specific aim to assess the pharmacists with respect to satisfaction with the training program and the overall project, the activities conducted in patient sessions, and the time taken to complete the visits in this study.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Hemoglobin A-1C From Baseline
primary_outcome.description: Compare changes in Hemoglobin A-1C from baseline between the two groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes From Baseline in LDL, HDL, Total Cholesterol, Triglycerides
secondary_outcome.description: Changes from baseline in LDL, HDL, total cholesterol, triglycerides. Sample sizes for each individual test (usual care plus out-of-pocket cost waiver; EMPOWER group): LDL HDL Total cholesterol Triglycerides

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Economic Outcomes (Total Cost of Care, Cost of Diabetes Medications, Cost of Diabetes Supplies) From Baseline to 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in claims-based economic data on costs of total health care, diabetes medications, and diabetes supplies from baseline to 12 months. Only participants who had a claim in the 12 months prior to baseline were included in these analyses. The resulting sample sizes (usual care plus out-of-pocket cost waiver; EMPOWER group) for these outcomes are: Total cost of care Costs of diabetes medications Costs of diabetes supplies

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Diabetes Knowledge and Empowerment (Patient Self-efficacy) From Baseline to 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Psycho-social aspects of diabetes knowledge and empowerment. Sample sizes are in parentheses (usual care plus out-of-pocket cost waiver; EMPOWER group): Changes from baseline to 12 months for the Diabetes Empowerment Scale (DES). Mean score for 28 items each scored as a Likert scale from 1 to 5. Higher scores correspond to greater empowerment Changes from baseline to 12 months for the Adherence Starts with Knowledge (ASK-20) adherence barrier test total barrier score (TBC). The TBC has a range from 0 to 18 and higher scores correspond to greater barriers. Changes from baseline to 12 months for understanding of diabetes. This is a single question: "How would you rate your understanding of diabetes and its treatment?" which uses a 7-point scale Likert scale as the response from 1 (poor) to 7 (excellent).

clinical_study.condition: Type I or Type II Diabetes (Excludes Gestational Diabetes)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Usual Care plus out-of-pocket cost waiver
arm_group.description: Patients received educational materials (handouts) in the mail. This was assumed to be of minimal effectiveness. Patients also received waiver of out-of-pocket expenses for diabetes care.
Patients were scheduled for free counseling with pharmacists including medication, diet, and other self-management items. Patients also received waiver of out-of-pocket expenses for diabetes care.

intervention.description: Patients were scheduled for free counseling with pharmacists including medication, diet, and other self-management items. Patients also received waiver of out-of-pocket expenses for diabetes care.
Patients received educational materials (handouts) in the mail. This was assumed to be of minimal effectiveness. Patients also received waiver of out-of-pocket expenses for diabetes care.
intervention.arm_group_label: Usual Care plus out-of-pocket cost waiver

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- diabetes (Type I or Type II)
- enrolled in health plan with participating employer
- age 18 or older
- willing and able to provide informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- gestational diabetes

overall_official.affiliation: Oregon State University, College of Pharmacy

results_reference.citation: Kraemer DF, Kradjan WA, Bianco TM, Low JA. A randomized study to assess the impact of pharmacist counseling of employer-based health plan beneficiaries with diabetes: the EMPOWER study. J Pharm Pract. 2012 Apr;25(2):169-79. doi: 10.1177/0897190011418513. Epub 2011 Oct 10.

group.title: Usual Care Plus Out-of-pocket Cost Waiver
group.description: Employees received a waiver of out-of-pocket expenses (copayments or co-insurance) for specified diabetes-related medications (including hypertensive and dyslipidemic medications) and physician visits. They also received printed educational materials at enrollment and about 3 months into the study.

group.title: EMPOWER Group
group.description: Employees received the same waiver of out-of-pocket expenses and also received up to 12 monthly visits with a pharmacist for consulting on monitoring and other educational aspects of diabetes self-management.

group.title: Usual Care Plus Out-of-pocket Cost Waiver
group.description: Employees received a waiver of out-of-pocket expenses (copayments or co-insurance) for specified diabetes-related medications (including hypertensive and dyslipidemic medications) and physician visits. They also received printed educational materials at enrollment and about 3 months into the study.

group.title: EMPOWER Group
group.description: Employees received the same waiver of out-of-pocket expenses and also received up to 12 monthly visits with a pharmacist for consulting on monitoring and other educational aspects of diabetes self-management.

class.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Change in Hemoglobin A-1C From Baseline
outcome.description: Compare changes in Hemoglobin A-1C from baseline between the two groups.
outcome.population: Specific employers were recruited and offered waiver of out-of-pocket costs for diabetes-related care to their employees to participate in the study. The number of participants reported reflects only those participants who had both baseline and 12-month lab tests.

group.title: Usual Care Plus Out-of-pocket Cost Waiver
group.description: Employees received a waiver of out-of-pocket expenses (copayments or co-insurance) for specified diabetes-related medications (including hypertensive and dyslipidemic medications) and physician visits. They also received printed educational materials at enrollment and about 3 months into the study.

group.title: Pharmacists Consults Plus Out-of-pocket Cost Waiver
group.description: Employees received the same waiver of out-of-pocket expenses and also received up to 12 monthly visits with a pharmacist for consulting on monitoring and other educational aspects of diabetes self-management.

measure.title: Change in Hemoglobin A-1C From Baseline
measure.description: Compare changes in Hemoglobin A-1C from baseline between the two groups.
measure.population: Specific employers were recruited and offered waiver of out-of-pocket costs for diabetes-related care to their employees to participate in the study. The number of participants reported reflects only those participants who had both baseline and 12-month lab tests.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis is mean change in usual care group equals mean change in Empower group. Power calculation required 150 per group assuming 25% would withdraw prior to 12 months.

outcome.title: Changes From Baseline in LDL, HDL, Total Cholesterol, Triglycerides
outcome.description: Changes from baseline in LDL, HDL, total cholesterol, triglycerides. Sample sizes for each individual test (usual care plus out-of-pocket cost waiver; EMPOWER group): LDL HDL Total cholesterol Triglycerides
outcome.population: The number of participants reported reflects only those participants who had both baseline and 12-month lab tests.

group.title: Usual Care Plus Out-of-pocket Cost Waiver

They also received printed educational materials at enrollment and about 3 months into the study.

measure.population: The number of participants reported reflects only those participants who had both baseline and 12-month lab tests.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison of change in LDL from baseline to 12 months between groups.
Comparison of change in HDL from baseline to 12 months between groups.
Comparison of change in total cholesterol from baseline to 12 months between groups.
Comparison of change in triglycerides from baseline to 12 months between groups.

outcome.title: Changes in Economic Outcomes (Total Cost of Care, Cost of Diabetes Medications, Cost of Diabetes Supplies) From Baseline to 12 Months
outcome.description: Changes in claims-based economic data on costs of total health care, diabetes medications, and diabetes supplies from baseline to 12 months. Only participants who had a claim in the 12 months prior to baseline were included in these analyses. The resulting sample sizes (usual care plus out-of-pocket cost waiver; EMPOWER group) for these outcomes are: Total cost of care Costs of diabetes medications Costs of diabetes supplies
outcome.population: Changes in claims-based data from baseline to 12 months among patients with at least one diabetes-related claim at baseline.

group.title: Usual Care Plus Out-of-pocket Cost Waiver
group.description: Employees received a waiver of out-of-pocket expenses (copayments or co-insurance) for specified diabetes-related medications (including hypertensive and dyslipidemic medications) and physician visits. They also received printed educational materials at enrollment and about 3 months into the study.

group.title: Pharmacists Consults Plus Out-of-pocket Cost Waiver
group.description: Employees received the same waiver of out-of-pocket expenses and also received up to 12 monthly visits with a pharmacist for consulting on monitoring and other educational aspects of diabetes self-management.

measure.title: Changes in Economic Outcomes (Total Cost of Care, Cost of Diabetes Medications, Cost of Diabetes Supplies) From Baseline to 12 Months
measure.description: Changes in claims-based economic data on costs of total health care, diabetes medications, and diabetes supplies from baseline to 12 months. Only participants who had a claim in the 12 months prior to baseline were included in these analyses. The resulting sample sizes (usual care plus out-of-pocket cost waiver; EMPOWER group) for these outcomes are: Total cost of care Costs of diabetes medications Costs of diabetes supplies
measure.population: Changes in claims-based data from baseline to 12 months among patients with at least one diabetes-related claim at baseline.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison of change in cost of total health care from baseline to 12 months between groups. Analyses not adjusted for other variables.
Comparison of change in cost of diabetes medications from baseline to 12 months between groups. Analyses not adjusted for other variables.
Analyses not adjusted for other variables.

outcome.title: Change in Diabetes Knowledge and Empowerment (Patient Self-efficacy) From Baseline to 12 Months
outcome.description: Psycho-social aspects of diabetes knowledge and empowerment. Sample sizes are in parentheses (usual care plus out-of-pocket cost waiver; EMPOWER group): Changes from baseline to 12 months for the Diabetes Empowerment Scale (DES). Mean score for 28 items each scored as a Likert scale from 1 to 5. Higher scores correspond to greater empowerment Changes from baseline to 12 months for the Adherence Starts with Knowledge (ASK-20) adherence barrier test total barrier score (TBC). The TBC has a range from 0 to 18 and higher scores correspond to greater barriers. Changes from baseline to 12 months for understanding of diabetes. This is a single question: "How would you rate your understanding of diabetes and its treatment?" which uses a 7-point scale Likert scale as the response from 1 (poor) to 7 (excellent).
outcome.population: The number of participants reported for each outcome reflects those participants who completed both baseline and 12-month surveys.

group.title: Usual Care Plus Out-of-pocket Cost Waiver
group.description: Employees received a waiver of out-of-pocket expenses (copayments or co-insurance) for specified diabetes-related medications (including hypertensive and dyslipidemic medications) and physician visits. They also received printed educational materials at enrollment and about 3 months into the study.

group.title: EMPOWER
group.description: Patients were scheduled for free counseling with pharmacists including medication, diet, and other self-management items. Patients also received waiver of out-of-pocket expenses for diabetes care.

measure.title: Change in Diabetes Knowledge and Empowerment (Patient Self-efficacy) From Baseline to 12 Months
measure.description: Psycho-social aspects of diabetes knowledge and empowerment. Sample sizes are in parentheses (usual care plus out-of-pocket cost waiver; EMPOWER group): Changes from baseline to 12 months for the Diabetes Empowerment Scale (DES). Mean score for 28 items each scored as a Likert scale from 1 to 5. Higher scores correspond to greater empowerment Changes from baseline to 12 months for the Adherence Starts with Knowledge (ASK-20) adherence barrier test total barrier score (TBC). The TBC has a range from 0 to 18 and higher scores correspond to greater barriers. Changes from baseline to 12 months for understanding of diabetes. This is a single question: "How would you rate your understanding of diabetes and its treatment?" which uses a 7-point scale Likert scale as the response from 1 (poor) to 7 (excellent).
measure.population: The number of participants reported for each outcome reflects those participants who completed both baseline and 12-month surveys.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison of change in Diabetes Empowerment Scale from baseline to 12 months between groups.
Comparison of change in Adherence Starts with Knowledge (ASK-20) from baseline to 12 months between groups.
Comparison of change in Understanding of Diabetes from baseline to 12 months between groups.

reported_events.time_frame: Follow-up of approximately one year post-randomization (about 400 days, on average)

group.title: Usual Care Plus Out-of-pocket Cost Waiver

They also received printed educational materials at enrollment and about 3 months into the study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
